sub_title: Director Data & Business Intelligence | MBA Big Data & Business Analytics | AI & ML trained
summary:
Ever since I was a kid, math, numbers and analytical thinking have been my passion. Later, I discovered the art and potential of transforming numbers and observations into databases and thus, defined my career´s vision: 

To drive business decisions by connecting business understanding, data handling, data visualization, coding and quantitative methods -statistics, econometrics and data mining-. 

Data for me is not a job, but my everyday and way of life.

-On my technical skills

	• I have +10 years experience with mixed data sets, tools, approaches (analytics, reporting, data science) and within different corporate functions including  customer insights, market research, category management, B2B and digital analytics. 
	• I have hands-on expertise with SQL and several data analysis tools (SPSS Modeler, SPSS Statistics, SAS, R,)
	• I enjoy creating data visualizations that are actionable, trustable and audience-driven (tableau, Google data Studio, Power BI, Excel)

-On my management style

	• I am able to translate analytics vision and strategy into execution.
	• I have 8 years experience in setting up, managing and leading high-performing teams.
	• I genuinely care about developing and coaching analytical teams and building the next generation of data experts.
	• As a manager, I empower my team members to do their best work and steer the use data as an asset.


-On what makes me different

My added value, both as a manager and an individual contributor, is to execute with excellence, maximize the use of several analytical tools & methods and go the extra mile, while understanding and connecting to the business needs to offer the best data-driven solution.

My mantra: 

“In God we trust, all others must bring data” (W. Edwards Deming)

I am a heavy LinkedIn user and enjoy learning and reading on new digital trends and of course, on data. Reach out if you want to talk about new opportunities, analytics and visualization.

profile_positions.description:
→Company Data Strategy: Develop and execute the company's data and business intelligence strategy, ensuring it aligns with the company's vision and objectives.

→Stakeholder Relationship Management:Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders across the organization to ensure alignment and support for data initiatives.

→Advanced Data Analytics: Drive the use of advanced data analytics and machine learning to extract meaningful insights from data. 
 
→Data Infrastructure Management: Oversee the operation and maintenance of data infrastructure and systems, including data warehousing, ETL processes, and data visualization tools.

→Personalization and Customer Engagement: Design the strategy and roadmap, and lead the implementation of a personalization and customer engagement experimentation program. Lead the strategy and implementation for the Customer Data Platform.

→Data-Driven Culture: Promote a data-driven culture within the company by by reinforcing data literacy, coordinating training opportunities, and emphasizing the application of data-driven insights in decision-making.
profile_positions.title: Director Business Intelligence & Data

profile_positions.description:
→Data architecture & engineering: Lead the creation and deployment of the Data Lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP), defined the data architecture, ETL and data models.

→Web and App Performance Analytics: Develop and implement comprehensive web and app analytics tracking strategy (data collection, measurement, visualization, and interpretation), leveraging tools such as Google Tag Manager and Google Analytics. 

→Company Reporting Strategy and Development: Develop the reporting strategy in Tableau for various teams including Digital, Marketing, Commercial, and Route Planning. This encompassed defining key metrics, designing intuitive dashboards, and training teams to leverage data for decision-making.

→Build BI team and Leadership: Lead the creation of the data and business intelligence team, designing the organizational structure and outlining the responsibilities for various roles. This included defining job descriptions for positions such as Business Intelligence Managers, Data Analysts, Data Engineers and Product Analysts. Successfully recruited and managed a high-performing team.

→Digital Customer Experience Optimization:  Implement, define, and deploye the Digital NPS & Web Feedback Button for real-time feedback collection.
profile_positions.title: Head of Business Intelligence

profile_positions.description:
→Data leadership:  Partner with the founders and leaders across the organization to identify analytics opportunities that inform decision-making and drive growth.

→Key analytical focus: B2C Customer acquisition (app downloads, conversion funnels, attribution models), customer acquisition ROI, performance marketing KPIs, website traffic, SEO, product engagement and user behavior, B2B Sales operational (activity ratios), and partner conversion metrics.

→Data architecture & engineering: Design, develop and maintain the data warehouse as well as maintain and execute ETL processes. Design, build, and own the data models, data pipelines, and database structures. 

→Reporting Strategy: Responsible to define and develop the reporting suite for the organization and enable self-serve for daily activities.
profile_positions.title: Head of Business Intelligence

profile_positions.description:
→Data Leadership: Set up and managed the data foundation for the EU Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) business, encompassing multiple websites and countries. Define and lead the strategic deployment of the EU D2C Data Marts.

→Customer Analytics: Create a robust consumer insights data model to improve understanding of key areas such as customer lifetime value (LTV), churn, customer acquisition, customer cohorts, and customer segmentation.

→Reporting: Design and implement comprehensive KPIs, metrics, and dashboard strategies tailored to the needs of the D2C Leadership and Management teams.
profile_positions.title: Business Intelligence Lead | Direct to Consumer Petcare Europe

profile_positions.description:
→Data analytics. Conduct exploratory data analysis across digital data sources to understand the performance of the Action websites (NL, BE, BR, AT, DE, PL, CZ), product performance, campaigns and category performance to identify improvement opportunities. Analyze a wide range of marketing activities, and evaluate the incremental value and impact on the website.

→Reporting: create and implement the different dashboarding requirements in Google Data Studio.
profile_positions.title: Digital Analytics Lead

profile_positions.description:
→KPI Development & Management: Led the creation and deployment of global operational KPIs.
Supported the partner services analytics group to evolve metrics based on feedback.

→Strategic Data Leadership: Defined the overall plan for enhancing global operational performance through data-driven insights, including audience definition, content selection, and session/deliverable frequency.

→Insights Development: Led the development of insights and narratives, effectively communicating recommendations to both regional and global teams.

→Data Visualization: Translated business needs into actionable visualizations by designing and wireframing new global dashboards.
profile_positions.title: Business Insights & Data Analytics Global Ops Lead

profile_positions.description:
→Reporting Strategy Leadership: Led the design and implementation of the reporting strategy for the Classifieds Marketplace.

→Customer Retention & Subscription Management Analytics: Developed a prioritization model for enhancing customer base retention and increasing subscription plans, employing advanced analytics techniques. Monitored customer/subscriber behavior to provide strategic recommendations on acquisition, retention, and portfolio management.

→Business Performance Analysis: Analyzed and evaluated the digital, financial, and operational performance of the business units, providing recommendations to achieve business goals.
profile_positions.title: Head of business intelligence & Planning (Mercadolibre.com.mx)

profile_positions.description:
→Topics: Macroeconomics, Microeconomics and International Finance.

→Lectures given in English and Spanish with self-designed class material, exams and practices.
profile_positions.title: Professor

profile_positions.description:
→Team Leadership: Led a team of market researchers and data scientists for super.walmart.com.mx.

→Reporting Innovation: Developed new methods of reporting, creating analytics, reports, and dashboards that effectively narrate data to business areas.

→Data-Driven Decision Support: Recommended specific actions based on research and insights on consumer data, including sales performance predictions, segmented product listings creation, understanding of products and audiences, adjustment of the commercial offer to consumers' needs, and the identification of cross-sell and up-sell strategies using data mining techniques.

→Market Research & Consumer Behavior Analysis: Build an understanding of the market and consumers' shopping behavior and trends through surveys, focus groups, digital analytics, industry benchmarks, and external agencies. Implement quantitative algorithms on consumers' transaction patterns, creating probabilistic models for retention and Recency, Frequency, Monetary value (RFM).

→Cross-Functional Collaboration on data initiatives: Collaborate with key business partners, including marketing, trade marketing, digital operations, store operations, category management, joint business marketing, user experience, and customer care.
profile_positions.title: Data Science, Market Research & Customer Insights Manager (walmart.com.mx)

profile_positions.description:
→Consumer Behavior Analysis: Classify consumers' transactional behavior (Recency, Frequency, Monetary Value - RFM) to understand business performance.

→Churn Management & Retention Strategy: Estimate churn rate, identified key moments for retention, and generated effective strategies.

→Acquisition & Retention Monitoring: Monitor customer acquisition and retention, analyzing key predictors, identifying trends, and presenting actionable insights to the business.

→Market Research: Conduct market research to understand online grocery consumers and identified main drivers of purchasing, employing both quantitative and qualitative methods.

→Strategic Planning: Design 3-year plan strategies from a customer's perspective to guide Marketing Strategies.
profile_positions.title: Consumer Insights Manager (walmart.com.mx & superama.com.mx)

profile_positions.description:
→Sales Forecasting: Design and implement an econometric model for forecasting Year 1 sales for new Walmart stores based on location and demographic variables, achieving a 10% mean absolute error.

→Demographic Analysis: Estimate the parameters of key demographic variables for new stores to drive sales and profitability, with a statistical significance of 95%.

→Growth Strategy & Viability Assessment: Perform predictive analysis of the growth strategy for different Walmart store types, and potential locations, and evaluate their viability.

→Competitor Analysis: Develop a model to estimate competitor's sales based on location, sales floor, and regional market share, covering approximately 3000 retail stores.
profile_positions.title: Market Research Manager

profile_positions.description:
→ Advanced analytics. Create a forecasting model of all the operations derived from pawning for all the business units.  Simulation, analysis, and evaluation of new projects that impact the operation

→Data analysis. Discover relevant patterns in the operation and in customer behavior. Ad hoc analysis at regional and national levels. Evaluate the impact of advertising campaigns on institutional results.

→ Insights Communication. Elaborate executive presentations for General Management and Board.
profile_positions.title: Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
→Academic counseling to students, attending and monitoring the satellite sessions of the Global MBA in the subjects of Regional Business in Latin America, International Trade & Economics, Regional Business in North America.

→Classroom lectures: preparation of material and activities assigned by the Associate Professor.
profile_positions.title: Global MBA Facilitator
